definitions.definition: An event that causes a computer or other device to temporarily cease what it was doing and attend to a condition.
definitions.example: The interrupt caused the packet handler routine to run.

definitions.definition: To disturb or halt (an ongoing process or action, or the person performing it) by interfering suddenly.
definitions.example: A maverick politician repeatedly interrupted the debate by shouting.

definitions.definition: To divide; to separate; to break the monotony of.
definitions.example: The evenness of the road was not interrupted by a single hill.

definitions.definition: To assert to (a computer) that an exceptional condition must be handled.
definitions.example: The packet receiver circuit interrupted the microprocessor.
